intro: Stenopadus aracaensis, commonly known as the Aracaensis stenopadus, is a species of flowering plant native to the Andean region of South America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants commonly known as buckwheats. The plant is characterized by its upright growth habit and clusters of small, greenish-white flowers. Its leaves are typically narrow and lance-shaped, with a smooth or slightly hairy surface. Stenopadus aracaensis is adapted to grow in rocky and well-drained soils, often found in mountainous areas with cool climates.
